title: Dama Tatuada (Tattoo Lady)
marks: Signature, Title and Edition on back, in pencil: [X. Tavera II  Dama Tatuda  El
text: Interested in the intrigue and entertainment of the circus spectacle, Xavier Tavera created his "El Circo" series of portraits by constructing sets and posing his friends as characters. Tavera's tattooed lady blends into her composed environment, a chameleon seeking to be seen. As she stands slightly bent, captured in the light, she might be stepping out into the world or about to recede into her background. Tavera's characters may come across as outcasts, insiders, or both. Half a world and eighty years apart, Tavera's created characters converse with August Sander's documented circus artists.
description: woman standing in front of a curtain (red on top, multicolored pastel stencils on cream on bottom); woman wears a strapless black dress and black and white shoes and has tattoos on her feet, PR leg and both arms
creditline: The Sharon and Bill Richardson Endowment for Art Acquisition
